Please ensure the safety of our staff on 5th August Strike

Content
Dear Management of ___________,

According to sources as diverse as newspaper headlines (see attached link below) and various discussions on Facebook and web forums, a major strike is expected on 5th August (next Monday), with large scale assembly is also expected in our area. BAYERN DENY SANE BID

Bayern Munich say reports claiming the club have made a bid for Manchester City winger Leroy Sane are untrue.

Media reports in Britain and Germany have suggested that the Bundesliga giants had tabled a bid for the 23-year-old.

But Bayern Munich tweeted a statement, saying: "News reports made today stating that Leroy Sane has decided to join FC Bayern do not correspond to the facts." Skysport

Manchester United have been given fresh hope in their pursuit of Harry Maguire after the defender pulled out of Leicester's upcoming friendly with Atalanta but the two clubs remain more than £15 million apart in their valuations, sources have told ESPN FC.

United have offered £70m plus £10m in add-ons for the England centre-half but Leicester are holding out for £85m with an extra £10m in performance related bonuses.

Bologna, Bojan Krkic nearing transfer to Montreal Impact

Bojan Krkic is nearing a transfer to the Montreal Impact. The class of '90 attacker landed in Bologna and, in this moment, is headed to a meeting at Casteldebole, home of the rossoblù, but obviously also the nerve center of the Saputo group. The parties are close to finalizing the deal.

Therefore, Sabatini is working on another acquisition after Lappalainen, signed from Bologna and brought to Montreal. Bojan appeared 21 times for Bologna last season, scoring one goal.

Ajax midfielder Donny van de Beek has confirmed Real Madrid want to sign him this summer following strong media speculation.

Marca and Diario AS both lead their Friday coverage with the news that the Dutchman is the most likely midfield reinforcement to join Los Blancos this month.

Barça sign Junior Firpo

The club and Real Betis have reached an agreement for the transfer of the left-back for the next five seasons

FC Barcelona and Real Betis have reached an agreement for the transfer of Junior Firpo for an amount of 18 million euros plus 12 million euros in variables.

The player will sign a contract with the club for the next five seasons, until June 30, 2024, with a termination clause of 200 million euros.

https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/football/first-team/news/1300141/barca-sign-junior-firpo

Bordeaux pull out of talks for Cristian Pavon, LA Galaxy set to land him

Ligue 1 side Bordeaux have ended talks with Boca Juniors for Argentinian winger Cristian Pavon, after the latter club demanded that a clause could be inserted in the proposed 2-year long loan that would allow them to sell the player to another team at any point, according to the well-sourced local outlet Girondinfos.

Conversely, LA Galaxy have agreed to this same condition and are therefore set to land the 23-year-old.

The deal would have seen Les Girondins take the player on a 2-year loan with the option to purchase at the end.

Speaking with Sky Sports Italia, Napoli president Aurelio De Laurentiis has admitted that his club have discussed the idea of signing Lukaku.

"Do you know why something is whispered about him? Because I am a good friend of his agent [Federico] Pastorello , who is very nice to me and I often wake up at dawn.

"I asked him: 'Lukaku would be good for Napoli? But he goes to Juventus or no? 'We spoke in these terms, then we know -- added the president of Naples -- the prosecutors also artfully have an interest in saying that an extra request has arrived for their client to increase the price with another party.

"For this reason I say: we open the market the day after the championship ends and we close it at the end of July. "

It sounds as if Napoli have moved on from Lukaku, but Saturday there were rumours that Napoli could offer Polish striker Arkadiusz Milik and cash for the Belgian striker. Stay tuned.

Arsenal make enquiries for Upamecano and Rugani in attempt to improve defence

Arsenal have been informed that they must pay around £70m to sign Dayot Upamecano from RB Leipzig as they step up attempts to recruit defensive reinforcements before Thursday’s transfer deadline.

After completing the purchase of Nicolas Pépé from Lille last week for £72m, the France Under-21 international has been identified as the club’s preferred defensive target, although the Bundesliga side are understood to be reluctant to allow him to leave despite only having two years left on his contract. Reports in Germany have claimed that a €60m (£55m) offer was rejected by RB over the weekend, although it is believed that Arsenal have yet to submit an official bid for the 20-year-old central defender, who moved to Germany as a teenager in 2015 from Valenciennes having rejected an appraoch from Manchester United.

There is also interest in Juventus defender Daniele Rugani, with Arsenal exploring the possibility of signing the Italian initially international on loan having been quoted around £50m to buy him outright. Laurent Koscielny, meanwhile, looks likely to leave the Emirates with Bordeaux and Rennes both keen on the 33-year-old.

https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/aug/05/arsenal-target-dayot-upamecano-or-daniele-rugani-to-improve-defence

Benjamin Henrichs to Werder Bremen is off

A deal for Benjamin Henrichs to Werder Bremen is currently off the table, according to Bild.

Quintet interested in Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig)

Premier League duo Crystal Palace and Aston Villa are showing an interest in RB Leipzig forward Jean-Kevin Augustin, according to Sky Sports.

The Bundesliga club would be willing to sell the 22-year-old Frenchman with RB Leipzig looking to recoup the €16 million they paid for him in 2017 from PSG.

AS Monaco and OGC Nice have also registered their interest.

Koscielny to join Bordeaux

Laurent Koscielny is leaving us to join Ligue 1 side Bordeaux.

The centre back has made 353 appearances for us since signing from Lorient in 2010. He was part of our Emirates FA Cup-winning squads in 2014, 2015 and 2017.

Laurent, who started his career in the French second division at Guingamp in 2004, has played 51 matches for France and was entering the final year of his current contract with us. We decided to sanction his move to Bordeaux once we agreed acceptable transfer terms.

We thank Laurent for his contribution to the club and wish him all the best for the future.

The transfer is subject to the completion of regulatory processes.

https://www.arsenal.com/news/koscielny-to-join-bordeaux
